result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald E Bellows Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $46.94 cash bond be applied to the fine and costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

10:17 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2015CM16 and count 1 on 2014CM106 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Further statement by the Court - Restitution of $94.78 is on file in 2014CM106 & $153.06 is on file in 2015CM16.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2014CM106 & count 1 in 2015CM16.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  (EACH COUNT)  $100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders any money on file in the cases is to be first applied to the restitution and any balance to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 10:00 am

Statement by Atty Privat - has had an offer in this matter for quite some time, defendant is to pay restitution and has heard from the defendant that he had no ride.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on September 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. and mandatory appearance of defendant or warrant will be issued.
